intro: Lecomtella, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are typically shrubs with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are usually evergreen, needle-like, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Lecomtella species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in acidic, well-drained soils.
